metadata.name: useIsMobile
metadata.description: A React hook that detects whether the current viewport width is below the mobile breakpoint (768px). It returns a boolean value indicating if the device is in mobile view. The hook automatically updates when the window is resized.
metadata.remarks:
- The mobile breakpoint is defined as 768px
- The hook returns undefined initially and then updates with the correct value after mounting
- The hook automatically handles cleanup of event listeners

returns.description: Returns true if the viewport width is less than 768px (mobile view), false otherwise

metadata.implementationNotes: The hook uses window.matchMedia to listen for viewport width changes and React.useState to maintain the mobile state. It sets up an event listener on mount and cleans it up on unmount to prevent memory leaks.
